name: Grants to States for Access and Visitation Programs
objective: The purpose of this program is to enable States to create programs which support and facilitate access and visitation by non-custodial parents with their children. Activities may include mediation, counseling, education, development of parenting plans, visitation enforcement and development of guidelines for visitation and alternative custody arrangements.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services

results.description: OCSE anticipates 54 grants in 2016. OCSE awarded 54 grants in FY 2016.

authorizations.text: IV, D, 469B, Social Security Act. 42 U.S.C. § 669b.

rules_regulations: The program regulations are in 45 CFR 303.109, “Procedures for State monitoring, evaluation, and reporting on programs funded by Grants to States for Access and Visitation Programs.”
